definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: Or, at least some prominent figures think so.
sentences.chinese: 至少某些知名人士是这样认为的。

sentences.english: But the problem is that some celebrity lecturers charge high fees, as much as hundreds of thousands of yuan.
sentences.chinese: 但问题是，知名人士的讲座费用很高，高达数十万元。

sentences.english: Whether he will also be able to claim to know those of the good burghers of celebrity-studded Neuilly is another matter.
sentences.chinese: 然而，马提龙能否拉拢纽利市的知名人士还是一个谜。

sentences.english: Many well-known figures attended the grand conference.
sentences.chinese: 许多知名人士出席了这次盛会。

sentences.english: A celebrity may live in a goldfish bowl.
sentences.chinese: 知名人士可能住在一个金鱼缸里。

sentences.english: A celebrity himself, he will probably face another one.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个知名人士，他很可能与另一个人面对面竞争。

sentences.english: If I had time I would chat with other notables .
sentences.chinese: 如果我有时间我会聊天与其他知名人士。

definition: all walks of life/all social circles
a person of virtue and prestige/a person of good moral standing and reputation
big shot (leading some field or group)/godfather
